alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 6:32AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following area, Cherokee County. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 AM EST, Up to around 2 inches of rain had fallen since midnight across parts of the county, high levels of runoff will be seen this morning, especially along and south of the I-85 corridor. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gaffney, Cowpens, Blacksburg, Kings Mountain State Park, Draytonville, Cherokee Falls, Thicketty, Saratt and Kings Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
